intro: Cordemoya papuana, commonly known as the Papuan cordemoya, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua, Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a diverse group of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its woody structure, simple leaves, and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
